pluggable.name: Relatively Popular Posts
pluggable.author: Ben Carpenter
pluggable.description: Track views of individual entries over a rolling time period, and allow the display of most the frequently accessed entries.

help.value:
Once activated, this plugin stores and updates a view count for individual posts, on a rolling basis of a configurable number of days (default: 30) and can be configured to count only users who are not logged in.

You can add a list of the most popular articles to your site by adding the 'Relatively Popular Posts' block in an appropriate place.

After your pages have started to collect some data, why not show a small graph on your page by editing your theme to include the code: $RelativelyPopular->sparkline($content);
